item.title: Cavite City debunks fake news of 2-day lockdown due to pertussis
item.content:encoded:
lockdown, pertussis, Cavite City, fake news, CESU Summary: The Cavite City Epidemiology and Surveillance Unit (CESU) has refuted claims of a two-day lockdown due to pertussis (whooping cough) in Cavite City. The CESU clarified that there was no such lockdown in place. The news of the lockdown was deemed as fake news, spreading misinformation and causing unnecessary panic among the residents. The CESU assured the public that there is no cause for alarm and that proper measures are being taken to address any health concerns in the area. The CESU urged the public to verify information from reliable sources before spreading unverified news.

In a case of fake news, the Cavite City Epidemiology and Surveillance Unit (CESU) denied there was a two-day lockdown of pertussis or whooping cough in Cavite City.

item.title: PCG: No maritime incidents reported during Holy Week exodus
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: maritime incidents, seaports, Holy Week, travelers, Metro Manila Summary: The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) reported that there were no maritime incidents in seaports during this Holy Week. As travelers began to return to Metro Manila on Easter Sunday, no untoward incidents were recorded, ensuring the safety of those on board. The PCG's diligent work helped maintain the smooth operations of seaports despite the influx of travelers during the holiday. This success highlights the importance of effective maritime safety measures and enforcement to prevent accidents and ensure the well-being of passengers and crew. As the holiday season comes to a close, the PCG's continued vigilance is crucial in ensuring that maritime activities remain safe and secure for everyone.

Summary:

No untoward maritime incidents were recorded in seaports so far this Holy Week even as travelers start to return to Metro Manila on Easter Sunday, the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) said.

item.title: PCG vows continued presence in West Philippine Sea following Marcos order
item.content:encoded:
Philippine Coast Guard, presence, West Philippine Sea, peace, China
The Philippine Coast Guard will maintain its presence in the West Philippine Sea to ensure peace in the area despite China's aggressive actions against Philippine vessels. This decision comes in response to escalating tensions between the two countries over territorial disputes in the region. The Coast Guard's continued presence aims to assert Philippine sovereignty and protect its interests in the disputed waters. By having a visible presence in the area, the Coast Guard hopes to deter any further aggressive moves by China and maintain stability in the region. The decision underscores the Philippines' commitment to upholding its territorial integrity and safeguarding its maritime resources in the face of external threats. Amidst the ongoing tensions, the Coast Guard remains vigilant and prepared to respond to any challenges or provocations that may arise in the West Philippine Sea.

Summary:

The Philippine Coast Guard on Sunday said it will continue to have its presence seen in the West Philippine Sea, at the same time maintain peace in the area, amid China"s aggressive moves against Philippine vessels.

item.title: Salubong at Pasko ng Muling Pagkabuhay dinagsa sa Quezon at CamSur
item.content:encoded:

The faithful also engaged in prayers, hymns, and reflections on the significance of Easter in their spiritual lives. The festive atmosphere filled with hope, faith, and love brought the community together to celebrate the central event of the Christian faith. The participation of the Catholic faithful in the Easter celebrations highlighted the importance of religious traditions and the unity of believers in honoring the resurrection of Jesus Christ. The joyful spirit of the Easter festivities reflected the deep faith and devotion of the Catholic community in Quezon and Camarines Sur.

item.title: 'Tais-Dupol' in Palo, Leyte stirs netizens
item.content:encoded:
penitence, Holy Week, Palo, Leyte, capirote Summary:
During Holy Week in Palo, Leyte, a tradition of penitence involving the wearing of the capirote, a Catholic pointed hat of conical form, gained attention on social media. The capirote is typically worn by members of a confraternity of penitents in Spain and Hispanic countries. This tradition has sparked interest and discussion online due to its unique and striking appearance. The use of the capirote in this context highlights the religious significance of the Holy Week observances and adds a distinctive cultural element to the practices in Palo, Leyte. The tradition of penitence during Holy Week is an important aspect of Catholic faith and is observed in various ways around the world. The distinctive visual symbol of the capirote serves as a reminder of the solemn and reflective atmosphere of the Holy Week observances.

A tradition of penitence during the Holy Week in Palo, Leyte made the rounds in social media because of the “capirote,” a Catholic pointed hat of conical form used in Spain and Hispanic countries by members of a confraternity of penitents.

item.title: Catholic faithful welcome Easter through 'Salubong'
item.content:encoded:
Catholics, Filipino, Sunday, Mass, Resurrection Summary: On early Sunday morning, Filipino Catholics observed Jesus' resurrection through a Holy Mass and the traditional "Salubong" ceremony. The celebration included a Mass to commemorate the resurrection of Jesus, followed by the traditional "Salubong" where statues of Jesus and Mary are brought together to symbolize their reunion after the crucifixion. This significant event is a powerful reminder of the belief in the resurrection of Jesus, marking the culmination of the holy week observances. The faithful gathered to witness and participate in this meaningful ceremony, strengthening their faith and devotion to Jesus. The combination of the Holy Mass and the "Salubong" tradition serves as a spiritual renewal for the Catholic community, reiterating their belief in the resurrection of Jesus and the hope it brings to their lives.

Filipino Catholics on early Sunday morning celebrated Jesus" resurrection through a Holy Mass and the conduct of the traditional “Salubong”.

item.title: Truce talks between Israel and Hamas to resume Sunday in Cairo --report
item.content:encoded:
Egypt, Israel, Hamas, truce talks, Cairo
Truce talks between Israel and Hamas are set to resume in Cairo on Sunday, as efforts continue to bring an end to nearly six months of conflict in the Gaza Strip. The discussions, facilitated by Egypt, aim to negotiate a ceasefire agreement between the two parties. The talks come after months of fighting that have resulted in significant damage and loss of life in Gaza. Previous attempts at reaching a truce have been unsuccessful, but hopes remain high for a breakthrough in the current round of negotiations. Both sides have expressed a willingness to engage in dialogue and work towards a peaceful resolution to the conflict. The international community is closely monitoring the situation and offering support to facilitate the peace process. The talks represent a crucial opportunity to halt the violence and provide much-needed relief to the people of Gaza.

Summary: Truce talks between Israel and Hamas will resume in Cairo on Sunday, with the aim of negotiating a ceasefire agreement to end the conflict in Gaza. Both parties are committed to engaging in dialogue and working towards a peaceful resolution. The international community is supporting the peace process, as hopes remain high for a breakthrough in the negotiations.

Truce talks between Israel and Hamas will resume on Sunday in Cairo, the latest attempt to bring about a pause after nearly six months of war in the Gaza Strip, Egypt's Al Qahera News TV reported on Saturday, citing a security source.

item.title: Salvage crews work to lift first piece of collapsed Baltimore bridge
item.content:encoded:
Salvage, crews, Baltimore, Francis Scott Key Bridge, collapsed Summary:

Salvage crews in Baltimore began the process of lifting the first piece of the collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge from the water on Saturday. The operation was underway in an effort to remove the debris and clear the waterway for navigation. The salvage crews worked diligently to bring up the section of the bridge that had fallen into the water. The process involved careful planning and coordination to ensure the safety of the salvage workers and to minimize further damage to the bridge. The successful lifting of the first piece of the bridge marked a significant step in the overall recovery effort following the collapse. The salvage operation was a challenging task but an important one in the restoration of the Francis Scott Key Bridge.

Summary:

Salvage crews worked to lift the first piece of Baltimore's collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge from the water on Saturday.

item.title: Pope Francis soldiers through Easter Vigil after missing procession
item.content:encoded:
Vatican, Pope Francis, Easter Vigil, St Peter's Basilica, concerns

Pope Francis presided over a lengthy Easter Vigil Mass in St Peter's Basilica, lasting more than 2 hours, amid worries about his fragile health at the age of 87. The service, one of the longest in Catholic liturgy, saw the Pope carry on despite his apparent frail condition. Concerns about his declining health have been growing recently, with reports indicating he has difficulty standing and walking. However, Pope Francis showed resilience and determination as he led the historic Easter Vigil Mass. The Easter Vigil is a significant event in the Catholic calendar, marking the resurrection of Jesus Christ, and Pope Francis' participation in the service was a testament to his dedication to his faith and his commitment to carrying out his duties as the leader of the Catholic Church. Despite his age and health concerns, Pope Francis continues to inspire and lead the faithful, showing a strong and unwavering devotion to his role as the head of the Church.

Summary: Pope Francis led a lengthy Easter Vigil Mass in St Peter's Basilica, displaying resilience and dedication despite concerns about his health at 87 years old.

Pope Francis on Saturday soldiered through a more than 2-hour Easter Vigil Mass in St Peter's Basilica, one of the longest services in Catholic liturgy, amid renewed concerns about the 87-year-old's frail condition.

item.title: Marcos orders strengthening PH maritime security amid China's aggression in WPS
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., executive order, maritime security, maritime domain awareness, China's aggression
Summary:
President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has issued an executive order aimed at strengthening the country's maritime security and enhancing maritime domain awareness in response to China's aggressive actions in the West Philippine Sea. The order emphasizes the need to protect the nation's maritime interests and asserts the government's commitment to safeguarding national sovereignty. By prioritizing maritime security, the administration is taking proactive measures to address the escalating tensions in the region and upholding the Philippines' territorial rights. This directive underscores the importance of maintaining a strong presence in the country's maritime domains to deter any potential threats and ensure the safety and security of Filipino seafarers and fishermen. Overall, the executive order signifies a strategic approach to defending the country's maritime territories and protecting its maritime resources from external encroachment.

President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has signed an executive order calling for the strengthening of the country's maritime security and maritime domain awareness amid China's aggression in the West Philippine Sea.

President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. on Easter Sunday urged Filipino Christians to ''live a Christ-like life.''

item.content:encoded:

The services will take place on Saturday and Sunday, where Pope Francis will deliver his messages to the faithful. Despite worries about his health, the Pope is determined to fulfill his important role in leading the Catholic Church during this significant time on the religious calendar. item.title: Babaeng kumain ng chicharon sa Peru, nakalunok ng pako
item.content:encoded:
Peru, operation, nail, choke, chicharon Summary: A woman in Peru underwent surgery after accidentally swallowing a nail while eating chicharon. The nail punctured a delicate vein in her throat, causing her to vomit blood. The woman had to be rushed to the hospital where surgeons successfully removed the nail. The incident serves as a reminder of the dangers of eating food that may contain foreign objects. It also highlights the importance of being cautious while consuming food to prevent such accidents from happening. The woman is expected to make a full recovery, but the incident has left her and others shocked at the unexpected turn of events. This serves as a cautionary tale for everyone to be mindful of what they eat and to always be aware of the potential risks associated with certain foods.

Isinailalim sa operasyon ang isang babae sa Peru matapos siyang makalunok ng pako habang kumakain ng chicharon. Ang babae, nagsuka ng dugo dahil tumusok pala ang pako sa isang maselang ugat sa lalamunan.

Police are investigating the incident and working to ensure the safety and security of all individuals involved.

item.title: 80-anyos na lola, panata ang pagluluto ng mola bola para sa mga penitente
item.content:encoded:
lola, Palo, Leyte, ginataang mola bola, penitente Summary: An 80-year-old grandmother from Palo, Leyte has taken on the tradition of cooking their version of ginataang mola bola for penitents during Semana Santa. The dish is a penance for her and is known for its unique taste that leaves a lingering sensation in the throat. The secret to the dish lies in the combination of fresh mola bola fish cooked in coconut milk with a special blend of herbs and spices passed down through generations. As a devout Catholic, the grandmother embraces the opportunity to offer her culinary skills for a spiritual purpose, believing that the dish brings comfort and nourishment to those observing the Lenten season. Despite her age, she continues to take on the responsibility of preparing the dish every year, staying true to her commitment to serving her community through her cooking. The ginataang mola bola has become a symbol of tradition, faith, and sacrifice in the town of Palo, embodying the spirit of Semana Santa for both young and old.

Naging “penitensya” na ng isang 80-anyos na lola sa Palo, Leyte ang pagluluto ng bersyon nila ng ginataan na mola bola para sa mga penitente tuwing Semana Santa. Ano nga ba ang sangkap nito kaya ito humahagod sa lalamunan?

item.title: Zelenskiy says without US aid, Ukraine forces will have to retreat
item.content:encoded:

Summary: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy of Ukraine expressed concern in an interview about the blocked US military aid due to disputes in Congress. This lack of support could have dire consequences for Ukraine's ability to defend itself against ongoing conflicts in the region. Zelenskiy emphasized the importance of the aid for Ukraine's security and stability, highlighting the need for continued support from the US. Without this assistance, Ukraine may be forced to make strategic withdrawals in the face of mounting pressure from external threats. Zelenskiy's remarks underscore the critical nature of external military aid in bolstering Ukraine's defense capabilities and maintaining its sovereignty in the face of ongoing challenges.

Summary: President Zelenskiy of Ukraine expressed concern over blocked US military aid due to Congress disputes, warning of potential retreat without support.

President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said in an interview published on Friday that if Ukraine does not get promised US military aid blocked by disputes in Congress, its forces will have to retreat "in small steps".

item.title: Marcos proclaims July 17 as National CPR Day
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., National Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) Day, July 17, proclamation Summary: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has declared July 17 as the "National Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) Day" to raise awareness and promote the importance of CPR training and skills in saving lives. This proclamation aims to encourage more people to learn CPR techniques, which can make a significant difference in emergency situations where immediate medical attention is required. By designating a specific day for CPR awareness, it highlights the crucial role that CPR plays in cardiac arrest cases and empowers individuals to take action in emergency situations. This initiative serves as a reminder for communities to be prepared and equipped to respond effectively in life-threatening situations. The annual observance of National CPR Day will serve as a platform for education, training, and public engagement to ensure that more people are equipped with life-saving skills.

President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has proclaimed July 17 of each year as the “National Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) Day.”

item.title: Mga antigong imahe, tampok sa Good Friday procession sa Tiaong, Quezon
item.content:encoded:
Grand Procession, Biyernes Santo, Tiaong, Quezon, mga antigong imahe Summary: The Grand Procession during Good Friday in the town of Tiaong, Quezon, featured antique images owned by prominent families. This event marked the first time that these antique images were prominently displayed during the procession. The Grand Procession showcased the rich cultural heritage of Tiaong, with these historic images becoming a focal point for the local community. The participation of prominent families added a sense of tradition and continuity to the event, making it a significant cultural and religious gathering for the town. The inclusion of the antique images brought a sense of nostalgia and reverence to the procession, allowing residents and visitors to connect with their shared history and faith. The event highlighted the importance of preserving and honoring these cultural artifacts, ensuring that they continue to be cherished and celebrated for generations to come.

Sa kauna-unahang pagkakataon ay itinampok sa Grand Procession nitong Biyernes Santo sa bayan ng Tiaong, Quezon ang mga antigong imahe na pag-aari ng mga prominenteng pamilya ng Tiaong.

item.title: 1 dead in Navotas fire on Black Saturday
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Fire, Navotas, dead, Black Saturday, person
Summary: A fire in Navotas on Black Saturday resulted in the tragic death of one person. The incident took place on a holiday, causing shock and sadness in the community. The fire ravaged a property, leading to significant damage, and the loss of life added to the devastation. Authorities responded to the scene promptly to bring the situation under control as the flames threatened neighboring areas. The identity of the deceased individual has not been disclosed, leaving friends and family members grieving the sudden loss. The cause of the fire is still under investigation as officials work to determine what sparked the deadly blaze. This unfortunate event serves as a reminder of the dangers posed by fires and the importance of fire safety precautions in homes and buildings. The community is left mourning the loss of a life on what was supposed to be a day of rest and reflection.

Summary:

Fire in Navotas left one person dead on Black Saturday.

item.title: Man assaulted while in act of penitence
item.content:encoded:
Man, punched, struck, wooden club, penitence
A man in Pampanga was punched and struck with a wooden club while performing an act of penitence in front of a church. The man was kneeling in front of the church in a gesture of repentance when he was attacked by an unidentified assailant. The brutal assault left the man injured and in need of medical attention. Authorities are investigating the incident and trying to identify the perpetrator. The motive behind the attack is unclear, but it has shocked the local community. The man's act of penitence turned into a violent and traumatic experience, highlighting the importance of safety and respect for individuals practicing their religious beliefs in public spaces.

Summary: A man performing an act of penitence in front of a church in Pampanga was brutally assaulted with a wooden club, leaving him injured and in need of medical attention. Authorities are investigating the incident, and the motive behind the attack remains unknown, causing shock in the local community. The incident underscores the need for safety and respect for individuals practicing their religious beliefs publicly.

A man was punched and struck with a wooden club while in an act of penitence in front of a church in Pampanga.

item.title: Israel's Netanyahu approves new Gaza ceasefire talks
item.content:encoded: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu gave the go-ahead Friday for a new round of talks on a Gaza ceasefire, a day after the world's top court ordered Israel to ensure aid reaches desperate civilians.

item.title: Blackouts hit Ukraine regions after Russian air attack
item.content:encoded:
Ukraine, emergency blackouts, regions, Russia, missiles

Ukraine declared emergency blackouts in some regions following a Russian attack on its power stations. The attack involved the firing of numerous missiles and drones overnight. The targeted power stations were left severely damaged, prompting the need for emergency measures. The blackouts were implemented in response to the widespread disruption caused by the attacks. The situation highlights the ongoing tensions between Ukraine and Russia, with the latter engaging in aggressive actions that have significant repercussions for the former. The incident underscores the vulnerability of critical infrastructure to military attacks, raising concerns about the safety and security of essential services in conflict zones.

Summary:

Ukraine said Friday that it had imposed emergency blackouts on several regions after Russia fired dozens of missiles and drones at its power stations overnight.

item.title: Pope leads Good Friday service, skips procession
item.content:encoded:
Easter, Pope Francis, Good Friday, St Peter's Basilica, Colosseum
Pope Francis presided over a Good Friday service at St Peter's Basilica before a night-time procession at Rome's Colosseum to commemorate Jesus' crucifixion. The pontiff opted out of attending the Colosseum procession to prioritize his health for upcoming Easter week events. Vatican officials confirmed that Pope Francis was in good health but decided to take precautions. The Good Friday service at the basilica was held to observe the most solemn day on the Christian calendar. Despite his absence at the Colosseum, the Pope's presence at the service expressed the significance of the day in Christian faith. The decision to limit the Pope's engagements demonstrated a focus on his well-being and responsibilities during the Easter season.

Summary: Pope Francis led a Good Friday service at St Peter's Basilica before forgoing the Colosseum procession due to health concerns. Vatican officials assured his well-being while emphasizing the importance of the day in Christian tradition.

Pope Francis presided over a Good Friday service in St Peter's Basilica ahead of a night-time procession at Rome's Colosseum for the most somber day in the Christian calendar, marking Jesus' death by crucifixion. The pontiff, the Vatican said, will not attend a Good Friday procession at Rome's Colosseum to protect his health ahead of other Easter week engagements.

item.title: Moscow court puts ninth suspect in concert hall attack under pre-trial custody
item.content:encoded:
Moscow, district court, ruling, suspect, custody
Summary: A Moscow district court has ruled that the ninth suspect in the concert hall attack, which resulted in the deaths of over 140 people, will be held in custody until May 22 pending trial. The ruling was made on Friday, with the court determining that there is enough evidence to keep the suspect detained. The attack took place on March 22 and was a tragic event that shook the community. The suspect will remain in custody until the trial begins, scheduled for May 22. The ruling demonstrates the seriousness of the charges against the suspect and the importance of ensuring they remain in custody until the trial proceedings can take place.

A Moscow district court ruled on Friday that the ninth suspect in the March 22 concert hall attack in which more than 140 people were killed should be held in custody until May 22 pending trial.

item.title: Nigerian village celebrates the return of kidnapped students
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Kuriga, village, Nigeria, abduction, students Summary: The village of Kuriga in Nigeria's northwest joyously welcomed back over 100 students and staff who were abducted earlier in the month. The community members ran towards the convoy of buses, expressing gratitude with cries of "Our children are back!" and "Alhamdulillah," which translates to "Thank you, God". The emotional reunion marked the return of the abductees, who had been taken from their school. This incident highlights the ongoing issue of abductions in Nigeria, particularly in the northwest region. It serves as a reminder of the challenges faced by students and staff in the country. The safe return of the individuals abducted has brought a sense of relief and happiness to the village of Kuriga and underscores the importance of community support in times of crisis. The community's response reflects the resilience and unity in the face of adversity.

The whole village of Kuriga ran towards the convoy of buses shouting "Our children are back!" and "Alhamdulillah," meaning "Thank you, God", to welcome home more than 100 students and staff who were abducted this month in Nigeria's northwest.

item.title: Thai crane collapse kills seven - police
item.content:encoded:
Thailand, crane, construction work, factory, police Summary: Seven people lost their lives in Thailand on Friday when a crane collapsed during construction work at a factory. The tragic incident occurred, resulting in a fatal outcome for the workers present at the site. The police confirmed the death toll and initiated an investigation to determine the cause of the crane's collapse. The authorities have not disclosed any further details regarding the specific circumstances surrounding the accident. The incident serves as a reminder of the risks associated with construction work and the importance of stringent safety measures to prevent such tragedies from occurring in the future. The community mourns the loss of the seven individuals who tragically lost their lives in this unexpected and devastating event.

Summary:

Seven people were killed when a crane fell during construction work at a factory in Thailand on Friday, police said.

item.title: Filipinos mark Good Friday with prayers, some take flagellation
item.content:encoded:
faith, reenacting, crucifixion, devotee, San Fernando
Summary:
For 35 years, a devotee in Barangay San Pedro Cutud, San Fernando, Pampanga, has been demonstrating his faith by reenacting the crucifixion of Jesus Christ. The man has been dedicatedly embodying the suffering and sacrifice of Jesus by enduring the pain and agony of being nailed to a cross every Good Friday in a powerful display of his devotion. His reenactment attracts many spectators and pilgrims each year, who witness the intense and physically demanding act of faith. Through his annual portrayal, he aims to spread the message of Jesus’s teachings and inspire others to reflect on the significance of the crucifixion. The devotee's commitment to this religious practice showcases his deep spiritual connection to his faith and serves as a potent symbol of his unwavering belief in the Christian tradition.

For 35 years, a devotee in  Barangay San Pedro Cutud in San Fernando, Pampanga has been demonstrating his faith by reenacting the crucifixion of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Priest: No need for self-flagellation, follow Christ's teachings instead
item.content:encoded:
priest, Tondo Manila, advise, devotees, Christ's teachings Summary: A priest in Tondo, Manila, advised devotees to prioritize following Christ's teachings over self-flagellation during the Holy Week. This message emphasizes the importance of embodying the compassion and love that Jesus Christ preached, rather than engaging in physical acts of penance. The priest's guidance suggests that true spiritual growth and connection with God come from living out the values and principles taught by Jesus, such as kindness, forgiveness, and service to others. By focusing on these teachings, individuals can deepen their understanding of faith and lead more meaningful lives in alignment with Christian values. The advice serves as a reminder to seek spiritual fulfillment through actions that reflect the essence of Christianity, ultimately guiding believers towards a more authentic and transformative religious experience during the Holy Week and beyond. The priest's words resonate as a call to embody the spirit of Christ in all aspects of life, fostering a deeper connection to one's faith and relationship with God.

A priest in Tondo, Manila advised devotees that following Christ"s teachings is better than self-flagellation during the Holy Week.

item.title: 700,000 devotees flock to Quiapo Church on Good Friday
item.content:encoded:
devotees, Quiapo Church, Manila, Good Friday, 700,000
Summary:
Over 700,000 devotees gathered at Quiapo Church in Manila to observe Good Friday. The annual tradition drew in a large crowd of worshippers who came to participate in various religious activities and ceremonies. The event was marked by solemn prayers, processions, and services to commemorate the crucifixion of Jesus Christ. The massive turnout of devotees highlighted the significance of Good Friday in the Christian calendar, with many believers expressing their faith and devotion through their participation in the religious observances. Despite the large attendance, the event was peaceful and orderly, with authorities ensuring the safety and security of all attendees. The overwhelming turnout of worshippers at Quiapo Church underscored the enduring tradition and spiritual significance of Good Friday for the faithful in Manila.

At least 700,000 devotees flocked to Quiapo Church in Manila to observe Good Friday.

item.title: Flood hits Davao, tornado destroys houses in Maguindanao del Sur
item.content:encoded:
flash flood, Davao City, heavy rains, houses destroyed, disaster
Summary:
Several houses in Davao City were destroyed after heavy rains triggered a flash flood. The disaster caused significant damage to properties and displaced numerous residents. The flash flood occurred as a result of the overflow of rivers and streams in the area due to the intense rainfall. Local authorities are currently assessing the extent of the damage and providing assistance to those affected. The city is facing challenges in managing the aftermath of the flood, including ensuring the safety and well-being of the affected individuals. Efforts are underway to help affected residents recover and rebuild their homes in the wake of this natural calamity.

Several houses were destroyed after a flash flood triggered by heavy rains ravaged Davao City, according to a "24 Oras" report on Friday.

item.title: Taal emits highest amount of sulfur dioxide in 2024
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Taal Volcano, sulfur dioxide, record, Thursday, emission

Taal Volcano emitted the highest amount of sulfur dioxide this year on Thursday, setting a new record for emissions. The volcano's activity has been closely monitored due to increased seismic activity in recent weeks. The emission of sulfur dioxide can have adverse effects on both the environment and human health, leading to respiratory issues and acid rain. Authorities are advising residents in the surrounding areas to take precautions and stay indoors if necessary. The increased emissions are a cause for concern and further monitoring of the volcano's activity is ongoing to ensure the safety of nearby communities.

Summary: Taal Volcano emitted a record amount of sulfur dioxide on Thursday, prompting authorities to advise residents to take precautions. The increased emissions are a cause for concern due to potential health and environmental impacts, leading to ongoing monitoring of the volcano's activity.

Taal Volcano emitted the highest recorded amount of sulfur dioxide so far this year on Thursday.

item.title: PCG probing alleged hacking of FB page
item.content:encoded:
Philippine Coast Guard, investigation, security breach, official Facebook account, alleged

Summary: The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) is currently conducting an investigation into an alleged security breach that reportedly occurred on its official Facebook account. The PCG is taking the matter seriously and working to determine the extent of the breach and the potential impact on its operations. The security incident raises concerns about the safety of sensitive information shared on the PCG's social media platforms and highlights the importance of maintaining secure online accounts. As the investigation progresses, the PCG will likely implement additional security measures to prevent future breaches and protect its digital assets. This incident serves as a reminder for organizations to prioritize cybersecurity and regularly evaluate their online security protocols to safeguard against potential threats and unauthorized access.

The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) is investigating an alleged security breach in its official Facebook account.

item.title: De Lima to Marcos: End drug war, stop the killings
item.content:encoded:
challenge, President Marcos, war on drugs, Philippines, Leila de Lima

Former senator Leila de Lima has challenged President Marcos to take more significant actions in the ongoing war on drugs in the Philippines. She emphasized the importance of addressing the issue effectively and pushing for concrete measures to combat drug-related problems in the country. De Lima's statement comes amid concerns about the rising number of drug-related deaths and human rights abuses in the government's anti-drug campaign. She called on President Marcos to prioritize the protection of human rights and ensure accountability for any violations committed in the name of the drug war. De Lima's challenge highlights the need for a more holistic and humane approach to addressing the drug problem in the Philippines, focusing on rehabilitation and social services for drug users instead of resorting to violence and extrajudicial killings. President Marcos' response to De Lima's challenge will be crucial in shaping the future direction of the country's drug policies and addressing the ongoing humanitarian crisis.

Summary: Leila de Lima challenges President Marcos to take substantial actions in the war on drugs in the Philippines, emphasizing the need for effective measures and human rights protection. De Lima calls for accountability, rehabilitation-focused approach, and prioritization of human rights in combating the drug problem. President Marcos' response will shape the future drug policies and address the ongoing humanitarian crisis in the country.

Former senator Leila de Lima has challenged President Marcos to “do something more” about the war on drugs in the Philippines,

item.title: OP mourns death of SEC Commissioner Hubert Guevara
item.content:encoded:
condolences, bereaved family, loved ones, Securities and Exchange Commissione, Atty. Hubert Dominic Guevara Summary: The Office of the President expressed its deepest condolences to the bereaved family and loved ones of Securities and Exchange Commissione Atty. Hubert Dominic Guevara. Attorney Guevara's passing has left a void in the legal and financial community, as he was known for his dedication and professionalism in his role. The President's statement acknowledges the significant impact of Guevara's work at the SEC and extends sympathies to those who knew him. Guevara's contributions to the financial sector will be remembered, and his loss will be felt by many who valued his expertise and service. The Office of the President recognizes the grief and sorrow felt by Guevara's family and friends during this difficult time.

The Office of the President expressed its deepest condolences to the bereaved family and loved ones of Securities and Exchange Commissione Atty. Hubert Dominic Guevara.

item.title: 'Where I found happiness': A man's return to Pag-asa Island for hope
item.content:encoded:
Chinese, harassments, Pag-asa Island, hope, man Summary: Despite facing constant harassments from the Chinese, a Filipino man remains steadfast in his belief that Pag-asa Island symbolizes hope. The man sees the island as a beacon of resilience and strength, embodying the spirit of the Filipino people in the face of adversity. Despite the challenges and tensions surrounding the island, he remains optimistic about its future and the role it plays in the Philippines' territorial integrity. The man's unwavering faith in Pag-asa Island serves as a testament to the resilience of the Filipino spirit in the face of external pressures. Amidst the harassment and threats, his perspective offers a glimmer of hope and determination, illustrating the power of belief in the face of adversity.

Despite harassments from the Chinese, a man sees Pag-asa Island as an island of hope.

item.title: PNP: Fatalities from Holy Week drowning incidents now 8
item.content:encoded: Eight people, including minors, have died due to drowning incidents this Holy Week, the Philippine National Police said on Friday.

item.title: Pope washes feet of 12 women prisoners on Holy Thursday
item.content:encoded:
Pope Francis, prisoners, compassion, washing feet, Holy Thursday
Summary: On Holy Thursday, Pope Francis showcased his compassion for prisoners by washing the feet of 12 incarcerated women in Rome. This gesture is part of a rite marking Holy Thursday before Easter and is in line with the Pope's advocacy for mercy and respect for those in prison. This act of humility and service reflects the Pope's commitment to reaching out to marginalized and vulnerable members of society, demonstrating love and acceptance to those often overlooked. By including incarcerated women in this traditional ceremony, Pope Francis sends a powerful message of inclusion and forgiveness, reminding the world of the importance of compassion and empathy towards all individuals, regardless of their circumstances. This act highlights the Pope's belief in the transformative power of forgiveness and redemption, reinforcing his teachings of mercy and compassion for those in need of healing and reconciliation.

Pope Francis, who often pleads for compassion to prisoners, washed the feet of 12 incarcerated women in Rome on Thursday in a rite marking Holy Thursday before Easter.

item.title: Abalos: Erring cops to be held accountable over drug killings in Davao City
item.content:encoded:
errant cops, anti-narcotics operations, Interior Secretary, Davao City, accountability Summary: Interior Secretary Benhur Abalos of the Philippines has promised to hold accountable any police officers found to be involved in violent anti-narcotics operations in Davao City. This declaration comes after a series of bloody incidents linked to the crackdown on illegal drugs in the area. Abalos asserted that there would be no impunity for erring cops and emphasized the importance of upholding the rule of law in all operations. The statement serves as a clear stance against misconduct and brutality within law enforcement, reflecting a commitment to ensure that those responsible are held to justice. By addressing the issue of police accountability, the Interior Secretary aims to restore public trust and confidence in the authorities and their ability to maintain peace and order in Davao City.

Interior Secretary Benhur Abalos on Friday vowed full accountability for erring cops involved in a string of bloody anti-narcotics operations in Davao City.

item.title: Vaccination drive vs BARMM measles outbreak set in April
item.content:encoded:
immunization drive, 1.3 million children, Bangsamoro Autonomous Region, Muslim Mindanao, BARMM Summary: An immunization drive is scheduled for April in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao to target over 1.3 million children amidst a measles outbreak. The initiative aims to contain the spread of the disease and protect the vulnerable population. Measles outbreaks can have devastating effects on communities, particularly on children who are at higher risk of complications. By vaccinating a large number of children, the campaign hopes to create herd immunity and prevent further outbreaks. The Bangsamoro Autonomous Region is taking proactive measures to address the current health crisis and ensure the well-being of its young population. Through this large-scale immunization effort, health authorities are working to improve vaccination coverage and reduce the incidence of measles in the region. The success of the campaign will depend on strong community engagement and collaboration between health officials and local communities in BARMM.

Summary:

An immunization drive for over 1.3 million children in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (BARMM) is set in April amid the measles outbreak.

item.title: DND: China lacks ability to hold open, transparent, legal negotiations
item.content:encoded:
alleged, inability, open, transparent, legal
Summary: The Philippines Department of National Defense (DND) criticized China for its alleged inability to engage in open, transparent, and legal negotiations regarding issues in the West Philippine Sea (WPS). The DND called out China's lack of transparency and openness in handling disputes in the WPS. The statement highlights concerns about China's approach to negotiations in the region, emphasizing the importance of following international laws and norms. The DND's stance reflects the ongoing tensions and disputes between the Philippines and China over territorial claims in the WPS. By pointing out China's alleged shortcomings in conducting negotiations, the DND raises questions about the legitimacy and fairness of China's actions in the WPS. The DND's statement signals a renewed emphasis on upholding transparency and legality in addressing maritime disputes, particularly in the context of the WPS.

The Philippine Department of National Defense (DND) on Friday called out China"s alleged inability to conduct open, transparent, and legal negotiations amid the issues in the West Philippine Sea (WPS).

item.title: Bodies of 2 missing minors in Cagayan drowning incident retrieved --PCG
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: bodies recovered, 14-year-old boys, swimming, Solana, Philippine Coast Guard Summary: The bodies of two 14-year-old boys who went missing while swimming in Solana, Cagayan, have been recovered by responders from the Philippine Coast Guard. The tragic incident occurred on Good Friday. Despite efforts to locate the boys, they unfortunately did not survive. The Philippine Coast Guard played a key role in the search and recovery efforts, highlighting the importance of their work in ensuring maritime safety. The incident serves as a reminder of the dangers of swimming in unfamiliar or unsafe waters, especially during holidays when many people are out enjoying recreational activities. Our thoughts and prayers are with the families and loved ones of the two boys during this difficult time.

Summary:

Responders have recovered the bodies of the two 14-year-old boys who went missing while they were swimming in Solana, Cagayan, the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) said on Good Friday.

item.title: US provides Maryland $60M to start rebuild of collapsed Baltimore bridge
item.content:encoded:
emergency funds, Francis Scott Key Bridge, Maryland, debris, rebuilding
The US government swiftly awarded Maryland $60 million in emergency funds to clear debris and start rebuilding the collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore. This quick disbursement after the disaster is rare and crucial for fast recovery efforts. Officials in Maryland were grateful for the immediate assistance, as the bridge collapse has caused significant disruptions to transportation systems in the area. The state can now begin the process of rebuilding the bridge and restoring normalcy to the affected communities. The federal funding will be instrumental in covering the costs of cleanup and reconstruction, ensuring that the project can proceed without delays. This rapid response highlights the importance of government support in times of crisis and showcases effective collaboration between federal and state agencies.

Summary:

The US government awarded the state of Maryland an initial $60 million in emergency funds on Thursday to clear debris and begin rebuilding the collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore, an extraordinarily fast disbursement after such a disaster.

item.title: Lottery agents dare PCSO's Robles to show proof of 'scam'
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: online lottery agents, PCSO General Manager Mel Robles, scamming, dare, prove Summary: A group of online lottery agents is daring PCSO General Manager Mel Robles to prove his accusation that they are scamming lotto bettors. The group challenges Robles to provide concrete evidence to support his claims and accuses him of making baseless allegations. They assert that they are providing a legitimate service to lotto players and call on Robles to retract his statement if he cannot substantiate it. The online agents claim that they are operating within the bounds of the law and refute any accusations of fraud. The confrontation between the group and Robles highlights the tension surrounding the regulation and legality of online lottery services in the Philippines. It remains to be seen how this dispute will be resolved and what implications it may have for the online lottery industry in the country.

Summary:

A group of online lottery agents has dared PCSO General Manager Mel Robles to prove his accusation that the group is scamming lotto bettors.

item.title: South Africa bus crash kills 45 Easter pilgrims, Transport Ministry says
item.content:encoded:
bus crash, South Africa, Limpopo province, 45 deaths, Department of Transport Summary: A tragic bus crash in South Africa's Limpopo province has resulted in 45 fatalities and one individual sustaining serious injuries. The incident was confirmed by South Africa's Department of Transport. The crash highlights the critical need for improved road safety measures in the region, as such accidents can have devastating consequences on individuals and communities. The authorities are likely to investigate the circumstances surrounding the crash to determine the cause and prevent similar incidents in the future. Our thoughts are with the families and loved ones of the victims during this difficult time.

Summary:

A bus crash in South Africa's northern province of Limpopo resulted in 45 deaths and one serious injury, South Africa's Department of Transport said on Thursday.

item.title: Baltimore radio dispatch to stop bridge traffic may have saved lives
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Baltimore, Francis Scott Key Bridge, collapse, cargo ship, first responder
Summary:
Less than a minute before the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore due to a colliding cargo ship, a first responder quickly acted on the emergency call for help. The first responder, communicating through emergency radio, sent officers to halt traffic on the bridge in an effort to prevent any further disasters. The quick response from the first responder potentially saved lives and prevented further damage to the bridge structure. The cargo ship collision caused the bridge to collapse, leading to a chaotic scene that required immediate attention from emergency personnel. The importance of efficient communication and response in emergency situations was highlighted in this incident at the Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore.
Summary:

Less than a minute before Baltimore's Francis Scott Key Bridge collapsed from the impact of a colliding cargo ship, a first responder on emergency radio answered the crew's mayday call by sending officers to halt traffic onto the bridge.

item.title: World Court orders Israel to take action to address Gaza famine
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: International Court of Justice, Israel, food supplies, Gaza, Palestinian population Summary:

The International Court of Justice unanimously ruled that Israel must ensure basic food supplies reach the Palestinian population in Gaza without delay. The court's judges ordered Israel to take all necessary and effective action to ensure food is provided to the region. This decision comes in response to concerns over the humanitarian situation in Gaza, where access to food and other essential resources has been limited. The ruling highlights the court's recognition of the importance of ensuring the well-being of the Palestinian population in Gaza and the need for Israel to fulfill its obligations in this regard. Israel is now tasked with implementing measures to guarantee the timely delivery of food supplies to Gaza, in order to alleviate the suffering of the Palestinian people living in the region. This decision serves as a reminder of the ongoing challenges faced by the Palestinian population in Gaza and the responsibility of all parties involved to address these pressing issues.

Summary:

Judges at the International Court of Justice on Thursday unanimously ordered Israel to take all the necessary and effective action to ensure basic food supplies arrive without delay to the Palestinian population in Gaza.

item.title: Mga sasakyan na nakaparada sa daluyan ng baha, nalubog nang bumuhos ang malakas na ulan sa Baguio
item.content:encoded:
ulat, baha, sasakyan, Baguio City, pitong talampakan
Summary: In Baguio City, a sudden heavy downpour caused flooding up to seven feet deep, submerging 14 parked vehicles. The vehicles were parked along a waterway, and the swift rise in water levels caught the drivers off guard. The rescue operation to recover the vehicles and assist those affected by the flood was promptly launched by emergency responders. The incident highlights the vulnerability of low-lying areas to sudden and intense rainfall, emphasizing the importance of preparedness and rapid response in mitigating the impact of natural disasters. Efforts to raise public awareness on flood risks and to enhance early warning systems are crucial in safeguarding lives and properties in flood-prone regions like Baguio City. The affected individuals are advised to remain vigilant and take necessary precautions during inclement weather conditions to prevent similar incidents in the future.

Nalubog sa hanggang pitong talampakang lalim ng baha ang nasa 14 na sasakyan na nakaparada sa daluyan ng tubig nang biglang bumuhos ang malakas na ulat sa Baguio City.

item.title: Ruben Enaje, magpapapako sa krus sa ika-35 pagkakataon sa San Pedro Cutud
item.content:encoded:
penitensiya, pagpapako sa krus, Barangay San Pedro Cutud, San Fernando, Pampanga Summary: Residents are expected to once again participate in the traditional penitence and crucifixion reenactment in Barangay San Pedro Cutud in San Fernando, Pampanga on Good Friday. This annual event draws spectators from all over the country to witness devotees flagellating themselves and getting nailed to the cross as a form of penance and devotion. The practice has been a long-standing tradition in the region, with participants believing that it brings them closer to God and helps them atone for their sins. Despite concerns about the safety and morality of such extreme acts of piety, the event continues to attract both locals and tourists alike. The crucifixion ritual is considered a powerful display of faith and a way for devotees to show their dedication during the Holy Week observances in the Philippines. The cultural significance of the event cannot be understated, as it serves as a poignant reminder of the sacrifice of Jesus Christ and the importance of repentance and redemption in the Catholic faith. The practice of crucifixion may be controversial, but for many participants, it is a deeply personal and meaningful expression of their religious beliefs.


Inaasahan na muling dadagsain ng mga tao ang tradisyunal na penitensiya at pagpapapako sa krus sa Barangay San Perdro Cutud sa San Fernando, Pampanga sa Biyernes Santo.

item.title: Priest washes the feet of EJK victims" kin on Maundy Thursday
item.content:encoded:
Jesus, washing, feet, apostles, tradition Summary: On Maundy Thursday, priests in various parts of the country followed the tradition of washing the feet of devotees, mirroring Jesus' act with his apostles. In Manila, Fr. Flavie Villanueva took this opportunity to wash the feet of individuals who had lost loved ones to extrajudicial killings. This gesture served as a powerful symbol of humility and compassion, emphasizing the importance of serving and caring for those who are marginalized or suffering. By reaching out to those directly affected by violence and injustice, Fr. Villanueva demonstrated the Church's commitment to standing in solidarity with the most vulnerable members of society. This act of foot-washing took on added significance as it reflected the spirit of Maundy Thursday, a day that commemorates Jesus' profound act of love and service towards his disciples. As the priests carried out this symbolic ritual, they reminded their communities of the importance of humility, compassion, and solidarity in following the example set by Jesus.

In a similar fashion to Jesus" washing the feet of his 12 apostles, priests across the country washed the feet of devotees as part of the tradition of Maundy Thursday. In Manila, Fr. Flavie Villanueva washed the feet of people whose loved ones died in extrajudicial killings.

item.title: Flood buries cars in Baguio, Isabela after heavy rains
item.content:encoded:
rains, easterlies, thunderstorms, flooding, vehicles

Summary:
Heavy rains, influenced by easterly winds and localized thunderstorms, led to flooding in some areas of Baguio and Isabela. The heavy rainfall resulted in vehicles being submerged in the floodwaters. The easterlies and thunderstorms combined to create intense downpours, overwhelming drainage systems and causing the water levels to rise rapidly. The flooding affected roadways, making travel difficult for residents in the impacted areas. Authorities advised caution and urged residents to be prepared for further incidents of flooding as the weather patterns persisted. The situation serves as a reminder of the importance of being vigilant during the rainy season and taking necessary precautions to minimize the impact of such weather events.

Heavy rains induced by the easterlies and localized thunderstorms caused flooding in some parts of Baguio and Isabela submerging vehicles.

item.title: Palestinian PM Mustafa forms new cabinet, to serve as foreign minister too

Prime Minister, Mohammad Mustafa, new cabinet, foreign minister, Riyad al-Maliki

This change comes as a significant development in the Palestinian government, with Mustafa taking on the dual role of Prime Minister and Foreign Minister. It is a key decision that reflects Mustafa's commitment to managing both domestic and international affairs effectively. The reshuffle in the cabinet indicates a shift in leadership priorities and a focus on consolidating power within the government. The appointment signifies Mustafa's desire to have a more direct role in shaping Palestinian foreign policy and representing the country on the global stage. As Mustafa takes on this new responsibility, he will face the challenge of juggling multiple roles and navigating complex diplomatic relationships to advance Palestinian interests.

item.title: Lalaking nagpepenitensiya, sugatan matapos bugbugin at paluin ng dos por dos sa ulo

- Angeles City, Pampanga, Philippines, assault, penance

The attack, which was witnessed by many, left the victim severely injured and in need of medical attention. The perpetrators reportedly fled the scene before authorities arrived. The incident has sparked outrage in the community, with many calling for justice to be served. The victim, who is believed to have been targeted for unknown reasons, is said to be in a critical condition. The violent assault has shocked residents and raised concerns about the safety and security of individuals in the area. While the motive behind the attack remains unclear, the severity of the injuries inflicted on the victim has led to calls for the perpetrators to be apprehended and held accountable for their actions. The incident serves as a reminder of the importance of promoting peace and understanding in society to prevent such acts of violence from occurring.

Higit pa sa sugat na likha ng pagpepenitensiya ang tinamo ng isang lalaki matapos siyang bugbugin at hampasin ng kahoy sa ulo ng dalawang lalaki sa harap ng isang simbahan sa Angeles City, Pampanga.

The collapse prompted an evacuation of the building and an investigation into the cause of the structural failure, highlighting the importance of safety in public spaces. The incident serves as a stark reminder of the potential dangers that can arise in everyday situations and the need for vigilance in crowded areas.

item.title: King Charles praises 'hand of friendship" in Maundy Thursday message

The service holds historical significance, and Charles's recorded words will add to the solemn atmosphere of the event. Despite his absence, the king's presence will be felt through his message, allowing him to still participate in this important religious observance.

item.title: Menopausal women at risk of cardiovascular diseases --doctors
item.content:encoded:
menopause, women, symptoms, cardiovascular health, transition Summary: Before experiencing symptoms of menopause, women should undergo cardiovascular health checks as it is crucial in maintaining a healthy heart. Menopause is a significant life transition for women, and taking care of their cardiovascular health early on can help prevent potential issues in the future. Several doctors recommend proactive measures to improve heart health before symptoms of menopause start showing. Regular check-ups and assessments can identify any potential risks and allow for early intervention. Prioritizing cardiovascular health during menopause can lead to a better quality of life and reduce the risk of heart-related complications. Taking proactive steps towards improving heart health can set the foundation for a healthier future during this important stage of life.

Summary:

Menopause may be considered a big life transition for women, but according to several doctors, even before women experience its symptoms, they should get themselves checked to improve their cardiovascular health.

item.title: Iqbal seeks general amnesty for MILF combatants to join 2025 BARMM polls
item.content:encoded:
Amnesty, Moro Islamic Liberation Front, Bangsamoro Parliament, 2025, Elective Posts Summary: Amnesty should be granted by the Marcos administration to former Moro Islamic Liberation Front combatants to allow them to participate in the inaugural Bangsamoro Parliament elections in May 2025, according to Mohagher Iqbal, chairperson of the MILF Peace Implementing Panel. This move would enable former combatants to run for elective positions in the parliament and have a chance to contribute to the political process in the region. By granting amnesty, the administration can promote inclusivity and reconciliation in the Bangsamoro region, paving the way for former combatants to be involved in governance and decision-making. This initiative could help facilitate the transition towards a more peaceful and stable political environment in the Bangsamoro region, fostering greater unity and representation among its diverse population.

The Marcos administration should grant a general amnesty to former Moro Islamic Liberation Front combatants to allow them to bid for elective posts in the first ever Bangsamoro Parliament polls in May 2025,  MILF Peace Implementing Panel chairperson Mohagher Iqbal said.

item.title: Survey proved no need to rush Cha-cha --Senate leaders
item.content:encoded:

The Senate leaders seem to be prioritizing thorough analysis and proper deliberation over expediency when it comes to Charter change. Their stance indicates a preference for a thoughtful and deliberate process to ensure that any proposed amendments are well-thought-out and in the best interest of the nation. This cautious approach suggests that the Senate leaders are taking their responsibilities seriously and are mindful of the potential long-term implications of any changes to the Constitution. It appears that they are prioritizing stability and careful consideration in the pursuit of Charter change.

Summary:

item.title: PH, Vietnamese solons discuss defense cooperation at IPU sidelines

At the 148th Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU) in Geneva, Switzerland, lawmakers from the Philippines and Vietnam emphasized the significance of defense and security in light of the maritime challenges confronting the Southeast Asian nations. The discussions revolved around the importance of bolstering defense capabilities and cooperation in the face of maritime issues. Both countries highlighted the need for a comprehensive approach to addressing security concerns in the region, particularly regarding territorial disputes in the South China Sea. The engagements underscored the shared commitment of the Philippines and Vietnam to upholding stability and peace in the region through collective efforts. The dialogue at the IPU served as a platform for both nations to reaffirm their dedication to safeguarding their national interests and promoting regional security in the face of evolving security dynamics.

Summary: lawmakers from the Philippines and Vietnam underscored the significance of defense and security at the IPU, emphasizing the need for enhanced cooperation to address maritime challenges and territorial disputes in the region. Both countries reaffirmed their commitment to maintaining stability and peace through collective efforts and a comprehensive security approach.

Lawmakers from the Philippines and Vietnam have highlighted the importance of defense and security amid maritime issues faced by the Southeast Asian countries at the sidelines of the 148th Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU) in Geneva, Switzerland.

item.title: Two bodies found as Baltimore bridge collapse moves from recovery to salvage
item.content:encoded:
construction workers, Baltimore harbor, cargo ship, bridge collapse, potholes
Summary: Two construction workers were found dead in Baltimore harbor after a cargo ship crashed into the bridge they were working on, causing it to collapse. The workers were trapped in their red pick-up truck in the cold waters. The incident occurred while they were filling potholes on the bridge. The collision of the cargo ship with the bridge created a loud noise that resonated through the area. The bodies of the workers were discovered by rescue teams after the incident. This tragic event highlights the dangers faced by construction workers on job sites. The sudden collapse of the bridge serves as a reminder of the importance of safety measures in construction zones.

The bodies of two construction workers were found in the cold waters of Baltimore harbor Wednesday, trapped in their red pick-up truck after a giant cargo ship slammed into the bridge they had been filling potholes on, causing a thunderous collapse.

item.title: State of calamity declared in Cavite due to pertussis outbreak
item.content:encoded:

This highly contagious respiratory disease primarily affects infants and young children but can also be contracted by adults. By declaring a state of calamity, the province can now access emergency funds and resources to combat the spread of the disease and provide necessary medical care to those affected. The decision to declare a state of calamity underscores the severity of the situation and the urgent need for intervention to prevent further outbreaks. Authorities are implementing measures such as vaccination campaigns and raising awareness about the symptoms and prevention of pertussis to control the spread of the disease. Residents are urged to seek medical attention promptly if they or their children exhibit symptoms of whooping cough to receive appropriate treatment and help prevent its transmission to others.

The Province of Cavite has declared a state of calamity due to the rising cases of pertussis or whooping cough.

item.title: Ilang paraan para maiwasan ang disgrasya ng mga bata sa loob ng sasakyan, alamin
item.content:encoded:
Angeles City, Pampanga, children, car accident, prevention

Children aged two and three recently tragically died after being locked inside a parked car in Angeles City, Pampanga. To prevent such tragedies, here are some important safety measures that can be taken: 1. Be vigilant when children are around vehicles, especially parked cars. 2. Never leave children unattended in a car, even for a short period of time. 3. Keep car keys out of reach of children to prevent them from accidentally locking themselves inside the car. 4. Install child safety locks on car doors to prevent children from opening them from the inside. 5. Make it a habit to always check the backseat of your car before locking it, to ensure no child is left behind. By following these simple safety precautions, we can help prevent tragic accidents like the one that occurred in Angeles City.

Summary:

Dalawang bata na edad dalawa at tatlo ang namatay makaraang makulong sa loob ng isang nakaparadang kotse sa Angeles City, Pampanga kamakailan. Papaano nga ba maiiwasan ang ganitong trahediya?

item.title: UN expert in Israel genocide accusation says she has been threatened
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: UN expert, report, genocide, Israel, Gaza Summary: A UN expert who published a report alleging that Israel may have committed genocide in Gaza revealed that she had received threats during her tenure. The expert's report concluded that there were reasonable grounds to believe that Israel had committed genocide in Gaza. The report stirred controversy and led to an increased level of scrutiny on Israel's actions in the region. The expert's findings also highlighted the ongoing conflict and human rights abuses in the Gaza Strip, shedding light on the need for further investigation and accountability. Despite facing threats and backlash for her report, the UN expert stood by her findings and called for action to address the issue of genocide in Gaza. The report's publication sparked debate and raised questions about the situation in Gaza, putting pressure on the international community to respond to the allegations of genocide.

Summary: A UN expert who released a report accusing Israel of potential genocide in Gaza has faced threats, sparking controversy and calls for action to address human rights abuses in the region.

A UN expert who published a report saying there were reasonable grounds to believe Israel has committed genocide in Gaza said she had received threats throughout her mandate.

item.title: Canada clocks fastest population growth in 66 years in 2023
item.content:encoded:
record high, population, Canada, immigration, growth
Canada's population reached a record high of 40.77 million in 2023, with a significant increase driven by temporary immigration. The country saw a growth of 1.27 million people, marking a 3.2% increase from the previous year and the highest growth rate since 1957. This surge in population can be attributed to the influx of immigrants coming to Canada. In recent years, Canada has been welcoming a large number of temporary immigrants, contributing to the overall population growth. This demographic shift has implications for various sectors such as healthcare, housing, and labor market. As Canada continues to attract immigrants, it is expected that the population will continue to grow steadily in the coming years, potentially leading to further changes in the country's social and economic landscape.

Summary:

Canada's population touched a record high of 40.77 million in 2023, largely driven by temporary immigration. The country added 1.27 million people, up 3.2% from 2022 and the highest growth since 1957.

item.title: PH, US defense chiefs talk on phone after latest China harassment
item.content:encoded:
Philippines, USA, Defense Secretary, China Coast Guard, West Philippine Sea Summary: Defense Secretary Gilberto Teodoro Jr. and US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin had a phone conversation regarding the recent harassment by the China Coast Guard in the West Philippine Sea. The two officials discussed the situation and reaffirmed their commitment to upholding international law and ensuring the freedom of navigation in the region. The incident highlighted the ongoing tensions in the disputed waters, with China asserting its claims despite opposition from neighboring countries like the Philippines. The conversation between Teodoro and Austin signals a united front against Chinese aggression and a continued partnership between the Philippines and the US in addressing security challenges in the region. The call underscores the importance of international cooperation in maintaining peace and stability in the West Philippine Sea.

Summary:

Defense Secretary Gilberto Teodoro Jr. and US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin spoke on the phone in the wake of the latest harassment by the China Coast Guard in the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Roque: Duterte at Xi, may 'gentleman"s agreement' noon tungkol sa BRP Sierra Madre sa Ayungin Shoal
item.content:encoded: Naniniwala si dating presidential spokesperson Harry Roque na may kaugnayan sa "gentleman"s agreement" noon nina dating Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte at Pangulong Xi Jinping ng China, tungkol sa BRP Sierra Madre sa Ayungin Shoal ang ipinakikitang ang aksyon ngayon ng China sa West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Towed cars, vehicles without RFID slow down traffic at NLEX
item.content:encoded: Several cars broke down and had to be towed, while cash lanes on tollways experienced clogs due to the influx of motorists without RFID passing through the North Luzon Expressway (NLEX) during Holy Wednesday.

item.title: Myanmar junta chief calls for unity, says military holding power 'temporarily"
item.content:encoded: Myanmar's ruling general said on Wednesday the junta was holding power only temporarily with the aim of strengthening democracy, and he called for unity among the people and military to fight armed groups seeking to derail plans to hold an election.

item.title: Commuters, employees ride PNR's farewell trips
item.content:encoded: Employees and passengers of the Philippine National Railways bid its trains farewell on Wednesday.

item.title: Ilang simbahan o kapilya sa Intramuros, bukas para sa Visita Iglesia
item.content:encoded: Maraming simbahan at kapilya sa Intramuros, Maynila ang puwedeng puntahan ng mga Katolikong may planong mag-Visita Iglesia ngayong Holy Week.

item.title: No major lotto winners ahead of Holy Week break
item.content:encoded: There were no winners of either of the big lotto draws on Wednesday prior to the Holy Week break.

item.title: 88% of Filipinos against Cha-cha --Pulse Asia survey
item.content:encoded:
Filipinos, Constitution, Amendment, Pulse Asia, Survey
Filipinos are strongly against amending the 1987 Constitution at the current moment, with 88% expressing their opposition, according to the latest Pulse Asia survey. The survey results indicate that there is widespread resistance among Filipinos to changes in the Constitution. The findings highlight the sentiment of the majority of the population, signaling a lack of support for any constitutional amendments. The survey conducted by Pulse Asia provides a clear indication of public opinion on the matter, showing a strong preference for maintaining the current Constitution. The overwhelming response from Filipinos underscores the importance of considering the public's views and concerns when it comes to potential changes in the country's fundamental law.

Summary:

At least 88% of Filipinos are against amending the 1987 Constitution "right now," the latest Pulse Asia survey showed.

item.title: 2 tricycle driver, nagsuntukan at paluan ng tubo sa Ilocos Norte
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: tricycle driver, caught on camera, fistfight, Dingras, Ilocos Norte Summary: Two tricycle drivers were caught on camera engaging in a fistfight and hitting each other with a pipe in Dingras, Ilocos Norte. The altercation between the two drivers escalated quickly, with the footage showing them throwing punches and using a pipe as a weapon. The incident took place in public, causing alarm and concern among onlookers. The aggressive behavior displayed by the tricycle drivers has sparked outrage and calls for authorities to take action against such violent acts. This incident serves as a reminder of the importance of resolving conflicts peacefully and avoiding resorting to physical violence. Both tricycle drivers involved in the brawl have faced consequences for their actions, highlighting the need for individuals to exercise restraint and seek peaceful solutions to disagreements. The incident sheds light on the potential dangers of allowing personal disputes to escalate into physical confrontations. Efforts to promote conflict resolution and peaceful coexistence among individuals are essential to prevent such incidents from occurring in the future.

Summary:

Duguan ang dalawang tricycle driver na nahuli-cam na nagsusuntukan at nagpapaluan ng tubo sa Dingras, Ilocos Norte.

item.title: 7 dead in police ops after Baste Duterte declared drug war in Davao City -- PNP
item.content:encoded:
Suspects, killed, anti-drug operations, Davao City, war

Seven suspects have been killed in anti-drug operations in Davao City following Mayor Sebastian "Baste" Duterte's declaration of a war against illegal drugs. The operations took place four days after the mayor announced the crackdown on drug-related activities in the metropolis. The suspects were targeted in the efforts to curb the illegal drug trade and eliminate drug-related crimes in the city. The killings signal a strong stance against drug offenders and are part of the government's intensified campaign to address the drug problem in the area. Mayor Duterte's initiative reflects a commitment to maintaining law and order and ensuring the safety and well-being of the residents of Davao City. The decisive actions taken by the authorities aim to send a clear message that illegal drug activities will not be tolerated, and those involved will face severe consequences. The operations underscore the city's determination to combat the drug menace and create a drug-free environment for its citizens.

Summary:

Seven suspects have been killed in anti-drug operations in Davao City four days after Mayor Sebastian "Baste" Duterte declared a war against illegal drugs in the metropolis.

item.title: PCG vessel hits China coast guard ship that blocked its path
item.content:encoded: The Philippine Coast Guard vessel BRP Cabra accidentally hit a China Coast Guard ship that blocked its path on Saturday.

item.title: Road widening activities slow traffic on SLEX amid Holy Week rush
item.content:encoded: Apart from travelers headed to the provinces, road widening activities also slowed traffic in some parts of the South Luzon Expressway (SLEX), Mark Salazar reported on ''24 Oras'' on Wednesday.

item.title: Hanunuo-Mangyan people affected by drought in Oriental Mindoro receive help from GMA Kapuso Foundation
item.content:encoded: Hanunuo-Mangyan residents from Barangay Cambunang in Bulalacao, Oriental Mindoro were among those who were greatly affected by the dry season.
